subject: Writing
title: Lady Chatterley's Lover: The Obscenity Trial
description: A quick win: understand Lady Chatterley's Lover: The Obscenity Trial.

hook.text: A prosecutor asked the jury: would you let your wife or servants read this book? That question backfired spectacularly.

buildup.text: D.H. Lawrence's Lady Chatterley's Lover was banned for 30 years in Britain for its explicit sexual content.

discovery.text: Penguin Books deliberately published it in 1960 to challenge the Obscene Publications Act in court.

twist.text: The prosecutor's snobbish question about wives and servants turned public opinion against the censors instantly.

climax.text: The jury found the book not guilty. Two million copies sold in six weeks. The sexual revolution had a new symbol.

punchline.text: One pompous question lost the case and freed a novel.

quiz.question: How did Penguin Books challenge the ban on Lady Chatterley's Lover?
options: By deliberately publishing it to force a court trial
